metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11140 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
The ReadJPEGImage function in coders/jpeg.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26creates a pixel cache before a successful read of a scanline, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption) viacrafted JPEG files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-3
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-3
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-3
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-3
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-3').
